content: | 1 empowering beanie by justyna lorkowska empowering beanie by justyna lorkowska - lete s knits c 2022 all rights reserved for personal use only size cable stitches one size to fit head circumference 52 - 56 cm/20 5 - 22 left twist lt - skip the first stitch knit through back loop into the 2nd stitch length from picot edge to top about 25 cm/10 but do not drop st off the needle knit the skipped stitch and drop both sts off the needle | 2 yarn right twist rt k2tog but do not drop st off the needle knit into the first stitch again then drop both sts off the needle 1 skein of goya merino by cecily grove yarns 100% merino 400m/439y per 100 grams shown in color nocturne instructions 1 skein of drops kid-silk by garnstudio 75% kid mohair 25% silk 210m/229y per 25g shown in colorway 37 north sea brim needles with smaller size needle 3 5 mm/us #4 and holding both yarns together co 4 0 mm/us #6 circular needle at least 40 cm/16 long and dpns or 96 sts join for working in the round making sure not to twist the sts place appropriate size to get gauge marker for bor knit all rnds for 10 cm/4 3 5 mm/us #4 circular needles at least 40 cm/16 long or dpns or two sizes fold the hem in half toward this inside and knit the next round of sts together smaller than gauge needles with the co edge as follows beginning with the first co st *use rh needle to pick up a stitch from the co edge and slip it onto the lh needle then knit this other stitch together with the next stitch on the lh needle* repeat to end of round make sure you are picking up the co st that is exactly aligned in the same stitch marker tapestry needle column of sts with next stitch on the needle so that the edge is knitted together evenly gauge increase round *k8 m1r* repeat around 108 sts 22 sts x 28 rnds over 10 cm/4 in twisted cable pattern worked in the round with needle 4 0 mm/us #6 with 1 strand of each yarn held together body take time to save time check your gauge change to bigger size needle 4 0 mm/us #6 and begin twisted cables follow the chart or instructions below abbreviations round 1 *k1 rt p1* repeat around round 2 *k3 p1* repeat around bor - beginning of round co - cast on dpns - double pointed needles round 3 *rt k1 p1* repeat around k - knit k2tog - knit 2 stitches together lh - left hand m1r - make one round 4 *k3 p1* repeat around right - lift loop between stitches from the back knit into front of loop rnds 5 - 8 work as rnds 1 - 4 p - purl repeat - repeat rh - right hand round - round ssk
